author: Bindu Shajan Perappadan
text:
Prevention is better than cure explains office bearers at the Indian Medical Association (IMA), the largest non-government organisation for allopathic doctors in the country — justifying its one-page note letter addressed to the Union Home Minister Raj Nath Singh recently, stating that they “condemn the anti-national incident that has taken place recently at JNU.”

The group stated that the move is also a strong message to all students in medical colleges across the country that “anti-national activities will not be tolerated.”

“We have 50,000 medical students, nursing students, etc, who through this intervention has been told that anti-national incidents have to be curbed and not debated upon,” said IMA honorary secretary general Dr. K.K. Aggarwal speaking to The Hindu .

The letter meanwhile adds, “We appeal to the government to take strict and necessary action against any person or organizations or groups carrying out any anti-national protest, speeches, debate or writings in the country.”

– Bindu Shajan Perappadan
title: IMA warns students
